section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document focuses on the first functionality, CDNI FCI. A key component in defining CDNI FCI is defining objects describing the footprints and capabilities of a dCDN. Such objects are already in . A protocol to transport and update such objects between a uCDN and a dCDN, however, is not defined. Hence, the scope of this document is to define such a protocol by introducing a new Application-Layer Traffic Optimization (ALTO) service called "CDNI FCI Map Service".
There are multiple benefits in using ALTO as a transport protocol, as we discuss in .

The rest of this document is organized as follows. provides non-normative background on both CDNI FCI and ALTO. introduces the most basic service, called CDNI FCI Map, to realize CDNI FCI using ALTO. demonstrates a key benefit of using ALTO: the ability to integrate CDNI FCI with ALTO network maps, YRY: add a sentence to say the benefits. builds on filtered ALTO maps to introduce filtered CDNI FCI maps using capabilities, YRY: add a sentence to say the benefits. further shows a benefit of using ALTO: the ability to query footprint properties using ALTO unified properties. IANA and security considerations are discussed in and respectively.
